name: power saw production, with catalytic converter | power saw, with catalytic converter | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22695/documentation

The composition is based on one type of power saw (produced in Stihl, Germany) and the transportation distances are partly estimated. This module should not be used if its relative importance would be high in a certain environmental inventory. Service life capacity, declared by producer: 2500 hours

Based on the module for power saw without catalytic converter, adding some ceramics, platinum and rhodium to describe the catalytic converter.
category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2818:Manufacture of power-driven hand tools

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The power saw studied is produced in Germany and used as proxy for RER. For some elementary flows proxys (other geographical origin) have been used.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: An average chainsaw weights about 7 kg. It is assumed that about 5.4 kg are unalloyed steel. The remaining 1.6 kg consists of the chain (0.4 kg) and the running rail (blade). Chain and running rail are made of highly alloyed steel. Service life of a chainsaw is around 2'500 service hours. The chain is replaced every 65 service hours; the running rail is replaced every 200 hours.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Most data obtained by personal communication. Data for the catalytic converter were extrapolated from data for car equipment.
